snippet: The grand jury indicted the teenager, Noel Estevez, 14, on a charge of second-degree manslaughter, the Bronx district attorney, Robert T. Johnson, said. Noel’s case will be moved to Family Court.
abstract: Bronx grand jury indicts 14-year-old Noel Estevez on lesser charge of second-degree manslaughter for fatal stabbing of fellow student Timothy Crump, also 14; case will be moved to Family Court, where cases involving juveniles are heard and penalties are typically less severe; Estevez, who says Crump had bullied him, was originally charged with second-degree murder and his case had been heard in adult criminal court.

byline.original: By EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS and BENJAMIN MUELLER

lead_paragraph: The grand jury indicted the teenager, Noel Estevez, 14, on a charge of second-degree manslaughter, the Bronx district attorney, Robert T. Johnson, said. Noel’s case will be moved to Family Court.

headline.main: Reduced Charge for Boy in Fatal Bronx Stabbing
headline.print_headline: Reduced Charge for Boy in Fatal Bronx Stabbing
